alert.note: Alert for Deltana and Tanana Flats (Alaska) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Red Flag Warning issued July 03 at 1:46AM AKDT until July 04 at 12:00AM AKDT by NWS Fairbanks
info.description: ...RED FLAG WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT FROM NOON TODAY TO MIDNIGHT AKDT TONIGHT FOR DELTANA AND TANANA FLATS... * AFFECTED AREA...Deltana and Tanana Flats. * TIMING...From noon today to midnight AKDT tonight. * WINDS...Southeast 15 mph with gusts to 30 mph. * HUMIDITY...As low as 25 percent. * TEMPERATURES...In the mid 70s. * IMPACTS...Fires could spread rapidly on Monday afternoon. South winds gusting to 30 mph are occuring in Delta Junction and will continue in Delta Junction through Monday night. The south winds are expected to spread to areas east of Delta Junction on Monday afternoon and bring Flag Conditions to most areas from Delta Junction east to Dot Lake from Noon Monday through midnight Monday night. Winds are expected turn westerly early Tue and bring cooler temperatures, higher humidities and a chance of rain Tue.
info.instruction: A Red Flag Warning means that conditions are occurring or will occur which could lead to the development of large and dangerous fires. It is directed toward fire agencies, and through them, to the public. Please advise the appropriate officials or fire crews in the field of this Red Flag Warning.
